transportAdvice: Hamburg has an extensive public transit network including metro (U-Bahn), suburban rail (S-Bahn), buses, and ferries that cover all major tourist areas efficiently. The city centre and waterfront districts are walkable, and taxis are widely available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold and grey with frequent rain or sleet; pack warm, waterproof layers.
Still cold and often overcast, though daylight begins to lengthen slightly.
Early spring brings milder temperatures but changeable, blustery conditions.
Pleasantly cool with occasional sunny spells; a good time to explore parks and the harbour.
Warm and increasingly sunny; one of the more enjoyable months to visit.
Warm early summer with long daylight hours and occasional afternoon showers.
The warmest month, ideal for outdoor dining and waterfront activities, with some rain possible.
Warm and pleasant with long evenings; the city is lively with summer events.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures with gradually shortening days.
Noticeably cooler and wetter; autumn foliage adds colour to parks and canals.
Cold, damp, and often foggy; the Christmas market season begins late in the month.
Cold and dark with festive Christmas markets providing a warm, atmospheric highlight.
